claim_text: As the bleak, bereaved, divorced and recently (and richly deservedly) suspended detective in HBO and Sky Atlantic’s Mare of Easttown , Winslet has sculpted high dramatic art from the crud of middle-aged female disillusionment.
evidence_snippet: It stars Kate Winslet as the title character, a detective investigating a murder in a small town near Philadelphia.

claim_text: She said she rather fancied a season at the Liverpool Everyman, but instead plunged into indie cinema and played a thoroughly unpleasant character in Jane Campion’s Holy Smoke .
evidence_snippet: Holy Smoke! is a 1999 comedy-drama film directed by Jane Campion, and starring Kate Winslet and Harvey Keitel.

claim_text: Stardom, however, was inevitable — especially after Titanic , a blockbuster everyone said would sink like the ship, but took $2 billion and won the Oscar for best film.
evidence_snippet: A 3D version of Titanic, released on April 4, 2012, to commemorate the centennial of the sinking, earned it an additional $343.6 million worldwide, pushing the film's worldwide total to $2.195 billion and making it the second film to gross more than $2 billion worldwide (after Avatar).

claim_text: When we met the first time she was mourning the death from cancer the previous month of her first boyfriend, the scriptwriter Stephen Tredre.
evidence_snippet: Stephen Ralph Tredre (17 July 1963 – 8 December 1997) was an English actor and writer.

claim_text: She seemed delighted by Mendes, but their marriage disintegrated too, and they divorced in 2010.
evidence_snippet: Amidst intense media speculation of an affair between Mendes and actress Rebecca Hall, the pair announced their separation in 2010 and were divorced a year later.

claim_text: In 2011 she was holidaying on Necker Island — as Mare never would — and fell in love with Richard Branson’s nephew Ned Rocknroll.
evidence_snippet: Ned Rocknroll (birth name Edward Abel Smith) is an English national who is best known as the third husband of Academy Award winning actress Kate Winslet
